Working with WA Environmental Health Disparities Data

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
library(lubridate)
library(here); here()
library(sf)
library(leaflet)
library(mapview); mapviewOptions(fgb = FALSE)
library(viridis)

#mytheme <- theme_classic(base_size = 14) +
  #theme(axis.text = element_text(color = "black"), 
        #legend.position = "top",
        #panel.background = element_rect(fill = "beige"))
#theme_set(mytheme)

#load data 
WA_EHD_df <- read.csv("./EJ_AQI/Environmental_Health_Disparities%2C_Overall_Ranking_(Current_Version).csv")

#make visual data
WA_EHD_sf <- st_read("./EJ_AQI/Environmental_Health_Disparities%2C_Overall_Ranking_(Current_Version)/EHD.shp")

st_crs(WA_EHD_sf) #WGS 84

#Visualize 
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = WA_EHD_sf, aes(fill = EHD_Rank, color = EHD_Rank)) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "A", direction = -1) +
  scale_color_viridis_c(option = "A", direction = -1) + 
  labs(title = "Environmental Health Disparities by Census Tract (WA)",
       subtitle = "Meg Manning",
       fill = "EHD Ranking (1-10)",
       color = "EHD Ranking (1-10)")

#Mapview
mapView(WA_EHD_sf)

#Create new df for EHD = 10
EHD_10_sf <- WA_EHD_sf %>%
  filter(EHD_Rank == 10)

#Map with EHD = 10
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = WA_EHD_sf, aes(fill = EHD_Rank, color = EHD_Rank, alpha = 0.2)) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "A", direction = -1) +
  scale_color_viridis_c(option = "A", direction = -1) +
  geom_sf(data = EHD_10_sf, fill = "red")
  labs(title = "Environmental Health Disparities by Census Tract (WA)",
       subtitle = "Meg Manning",
       fill = "EHD Ranking (1-10)",
       color = "EHD Ranking (1-10)")
  
#Interactive view
mapView(WA_EHD_sf, zcol = "EHD_Rank", col.regions = viridis(10, option = "A", direction = -1)) +
  mapView(EHD_10_sf, zcol = "EHD_Rank", col = "red")

mapView(WA_EHD_sf, zcol = "EHD_Rank", col.regions = viridis(10, option = "A", direction = -1))

#AQI Data 
AQI_2022 <- read.csv("./EJ_AQI/annual_aqi_by_county_2022.csv")

king_county_AQI <- AQI_2022 %>%
  filter(County == "King")

#Convert to spatial data 





```
